result.execSummary:
The defendant Cortez L Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcahrger, plus costs and disbursements and restitution (to be determined at a later date).  Should defendasnt get revoked, monies to be taken from prison wages to be taken from DOC not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Must be given literacy training.  Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment. Job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with the victim Sylvia B.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Anger management counseling.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Amended Judgment of Conviction
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (18 pages) commencing 05-27-2014 received and filed.

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No victim information received; State requested that the restitution be set at zero.  No objection by defense counsel.  Court ordered restitution set at zero.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Cortez L Wallace in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily, intelligently and with full understanding waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Court ordered that $500.00 cash bail and previously ordered conditions to remain in effect.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. State needs time to comply with victim notification. 
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz in court, defendant Cortez L Wallace not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Cortez L Wallace in custody.  Deann Heard for Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant be TOT to Justice Point: no firearms or weapons, no alcohol or drugs; random testing; no contact with any victims of this case.
Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $500.00 cash.

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Cortez L Wallace in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are in receipt of doctor's report.  Court has colloquy with defendant as to whether or not he feels he is competent to assist his attorney in this case.  Defendant stated that he does believe he is competent to proceed.  Neither the State nor defense counsel challenge the report.  Court finds that defendant is competent to proceed and ordered proceedings reinstated.   Court ordered case continued for preliminary hearing before Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/dated 3/31/14 and authored by Dr. Lundbohm, received and filed. rn
Case rescheduled to 4/04/14 at 8:30 a.m.  Dr. Collins to submit report to the Court by 4/03/14.   rn
/from Dr. Collins dated 3/21/14 requesting an extension to file report, received and filed. rn
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 03-28-2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Cortez L Wallace
Current: 1433 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 03-14-2014)
Prior: 1433 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Cortez L Wallace in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten, appearing for Kimberly Schoepp, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court they are prepared to proceed.

Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered proceedings suspended and defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 20.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Clerk:  jms
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Cortez L Wallace in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
OTP from MSDF
